A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her training, the girl meets a charming aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an enticingly large sum of money. The two horses eventually square off in the thrilling climax of the race at Aintree, England.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he holds about the agricultural, and his belief in Sakyou (the sacred deer).
The silent film depicts the world through the juxtaposition of Hakusan’s (Kenji’s father’s) shop and the deer.

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There didn't need to be too much that was good about this film. The ballroom dancing was super cool too. I learned alot about ballroom dancing. Actually what held my interest during most of this film, was just watching the dancing. Outside of that it was a great film.

No wonder "Hardcore" has found less admirers than the original.
